User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; ja; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 GTB7.1 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; ja; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101207 Thunderbird/3.1.7

When word wrapping is disabled by setting 'mailnews.wraplength' to 0, lines of the text being edited are abnormally wrapped at every word.
It seems to be a problem only with text display, and not to wrap actual text data.

To work around this, 'mailnews.wraplength' must be set to a large enough number.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set 'mailnews.wraplength' to 0 using the config window.
2. Open a message compose window.
3. Input an arbitrary text including space characters.
   For example, "the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog".
Actual Results:  
In the message compose window, the input text is wrapped at every space character.
For example:
the 
quick 
brown 
fox 
jumps 
over 
the 
lazy 
dog

Expected Results:  
In the message compose window, the input text is never wrapped.
For example:
the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
comments.author: software@arithy.org
